alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 3:29PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lawrence, northeastern Washington, Calhoun, Kanawha, Putnam, Lincoln, Wirt, Roane, Jackson, Wayne, Wood, northwestern Harrison, Pleasants, Ritchie, central Mason, Cabell, Doddridge, Mingo, Gilmer, Tyler, Logan and northern Boone Counties through 415 PM EST... At 326 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Sistersville to Chestnut. Movement was east-southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Parkersburg, Nitro, Ripley, Williamson, Madison, Louisa, Spencer, Winfield, Harrisville, St. Marys, Logan, Glenville, Wayne, Hamlin, Elizabeth, Middlebourne, Grantsville, Beech Fork State Park and Jefferson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 177. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 18 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 85 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 80. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 10 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building until the strong winds pass.
